CONTENTS.P: Business sector: Municipal and Environmental Infrastructure
Type of contract: Project goods, works and services
Type of notice: General Procurement Notice
This General Procurement Notice updates the original GPN 8072-GPN-47458, which was published in Procurement Opportunities on 17.11.2015 and updated on 28.4.2017.

GKP Semey Vodokanal, Semey, Kazakhstan (the “Company”), the municipal water and wastewater utility of the city of Semey (the “City”), wholly owned by the Akimat has applied for the loan from the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (the Bank) to support rehabilitation and modernisation of the water and wastewater systems in the City.
The proposed project has a total estimated cost of 8 400 000 EUR and will require procurement of the following goods, works and services:
— Reconstruction of water supply and wastewater networks and one wastewater pumping station,
— Block water meters and testing bench,
— Maintenance, leak detection, CCTV and laboratory equipment,
— Installation of hydraulic modelling incl. calibration/ measuring campaign,
— Introduction of a SCADA system and management information system,
— Implementation of water networks efficiency and development planning.
Tendering for the above contracts began in the second quarter of 2017 and is still ongoing.

Contracts to be financed with the proceeds of a loan from the EBRD will be tendered in accordance with the EBRD’s Procurement Policies and Rules. The proceeds of the EBRD loan will not be used for the purpose of any payment to persons or entities, or for any import of goods, if such payment or import is prohibited by a decision of the United Nations Security Council taken under Chapter VII of the Charter of the United Nations or under a law or official regulation of the Purchaser’s country.
Interested suppliers, contractors and consultants should contact:

GKP Semey Vodokanal, Semey, Kazakhstan (the “Company”), the municipal water and wastewater utility of the city of Semey (the “City”), wholly owned by the Akimat has applied for the loan from the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (the Bank) to support rehabilitation and modernisation of the water and wastewater systems in the City.
The proposed project has a total estimated cost of 8 400 000 EUR and will require procurement of the following goods, works and services:
— Reconstruction of water supply and wastewater networks and one wastewater pumping station,
— Block water meters and testing bench,
— Maintenance, leak detection, CCTV and laboratory equipment,
— Installation of hydraulic modelling incl. calibration/ measuring campaign,
— Introduction of a SCADA system and management information system,
— Implementation of water networks efficiency and development planning.
Tendering for the above contracts began in the second quarter of 2017 and is still ongoing.

Contracts to be financed with the proceeds of a loan from the EBRD will be tendered in accordance with the EBRD’s Procurement Policies and Rules. The proceeds of the EBRD loan will not be used for the purpose of any payment to persons or entities, or for any import of goods, if such payment or import is prohibited by a decision of the United Nations Security Council taken under Chapter VII of the Charter of the United Nations or under a law or official regulation of the Purchaser’s country.
